page.title: 12Housing in Linwood
page.content: Housing in{Linwood}has improved dramatically since the late 19th century, when tenements and cottages provided the housing stock. Houses still standing on the{Bridge of Weir {Road}were built around 1909 and form part of the old village. Most of the houses in Linwood are owned by the local authority; only{12%}of the population own their own houses. Between{1963}and{1977}the District Council built a total of{2329}houses. Also during the period{1970}to{1977 the {S.S.H.A.}built{1288}houses in Linwood, all of which helped to cope with the increasing population. The two most recent housing schemes in Linwood are located at{Mossedge}and {Greenhill}. Another small development is located in{Napier Gardens},adjacent to the school and are the most recent additions to the housing stock.
